snippet: The episode underscores the two nations’ tangled territorial claims related to an island chain near the northern Japanese island of Hokkaido that have been controlled for decades by the Soviet Union and then Russia.
abstract: Japan claims Russian fighter planes violated its airspace briefly on January 7; accusation, which comes on day of Japan's yearly rally supporting its claims to island chain controlled for decades by Soviet Union and then Russia, causes flare in tensions over long disputed territory; Russia denies accusation.

byline.contributor: Andrew Kramer contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: The episode underscores the two nations’ tangled territorial claims related to an island chain near the northern Japanese island of Hokkaido that have been controlled for decades by the Soviet Union and then Russia.

headline.seo: Japan Says Russian Fighter Planes Entered Its Airspace
headline.main: Tensions Flare as Japan Says Russian Planes Entered Airspace
headline.print_headline: Tensions Flare as Japan Says Russian Planes Entered Airspace
